parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From aion; perpetual.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
Blameless, without blemish, unblemished, faultless. Unblemished.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cleanse, make clean, literally, ceremonially, or spiritually, according to context. From katharos; to cleanse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
To serve, especially God, perhaps simply: I worship. From latris; to minister, i.e. Render religious homage.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
